item.title: 因 ESG 倒退而愤怒的资产所有者自力更生
item.description: ESG 在美国受到严厉打击后，在欧洲的监管力度突然下降，这让机构投资者开始探索新的杠杆，以迫使公司更加重视环境、社会和治理指标。【原文：After being bludgeoned in the US, ESG’s sudden regulatory decline in Europe has left institutional investors exploring new levers to force companies to take environmental, social and governance metrics more seriously.】

item.title: 参议院取消特朗普法案中的消费税，太阳能企业大涨
item.description: 由于参议院决定从唐纳德-特朗普总统的税收和支出法案中取消对风能和太阳能项目征收消费税，周二太阳能公司股价上涨。【原文：Shares for solar companies rose on Tuesday on the Senate’s decision to remove an excise tax on wind and solar projects from President Donald Trump’s tax and spending bill.】

item.title: 美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）预算削减将削弱气候和海洋研究并削减工作岗位
item.description: 美国国家海洋和大气管理局（National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration）提议裁员约 18%，并从预算中削减 15 亿美元，包括终止保护沿海社区的项目以及支持更好的预测和自然灾害预报的研究。【原文：The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration is proposing cutting about 18% of its workforce and slashing $1.5 billion from its budget, including terminating programs to protect coastal communities and research that supports better forecasts and natural disaster prediction.】

item.title: 阿夫沙尔离职后，马斯克将负责特斯拉在欧洲和美国的销售业务
item.description: 特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.熟悉内情的人士称，在奥米德-阿夫沙尔（Omead Afshar）高调离职后，特斯拉公司首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）接管了欧洲和美国的销售业务，让副总裁兼高级副总裁汤姆-朱（Tom Zhu）负责亚洲区的销售业务。【原文：Tesla Inc. Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk has assumed oversight of sales in Europe and the US, leaving deputy and senior vice president Tom Zhu over Asia, following the high profile departure of Omead Afshar, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 40 岁以下最富有的人在危险时刻全力投入绿色事业
item.description:
卢卡斯-沃尔顿（Lukas Walton）正在将他的气候事业带入充满危机的特朗普时代，而其他投资者和慈善家则纷纷退缩。【原文：

Lukas Walton is bringing his climate crusade to the fraught Trump era as other investors and philanthropists pull back. 

】

item.title: 热浪会造成多大损失？保险公司和首席执行官想知道
item.description:
在人工智能和数据中心发展的推动下，一个新的热能保险市场正在崛起。【原文：

A new market for heat insurance, driven by the growth in AI and data centers, is starting to emerge. 

】

item.title: 美国在电气化竞赛中输给了亚洲
item.description: 在电气化竞赛中，美国落后于亚洲的发展中国家；如果立法者决定对新的太阳能和风能农场征收关税，以支付唐纳德-特朗普总统的减税政策，那么这种差距可能会扩大。【原文：The US is lagging developing nations in Asia in the race to electrify — and that gap may increase if lawmakers decide to add duties on new solar and wind farms to pay for President Donald Trump’s tax cuts.】

item.title: 印度呼吁停止补贴助推清洁能源蓬勃发展
item.description: 尽管经过数月的行业游说，一项有助于推动印度可再生能源产业发展的重要补贴政策已经终止，这给本已面临需求过剩的印度可再生能源产业增加了财政压力。【原文：A key subsidy that helped propel the growth of India’s renewable industry has come to an end despite months of industry lobbying, adding financial stress to a sector that’s already grappling with a demand glut.】

item.title: 停电和火灾警报在危机发生前数小时从家庭传感器中闪现
item.description:
利用家庭传感器和人工智能，Whisker 实验室开发出了快速跟踪电力流以检测电网故障的新方法—；这让一些电力供应商望尘莫及

。【原文：

Leveraging home sensors and AI, Whisker Labs has developed new ways to rapidly track electricity flows to detect grid faults — leaving some power providers trailing

】

item.title: 热浪关闭埃菲尔铁塔塔顶，欧洲进入红色警报状态
item.description: 欧洲的热浪将在未来几天达到顶峰，从法国到瑞士阿尔卑斯山，一股股撒哈拉空气将触发红色警报。【原文：Europe’s heat wave is set to peak over the coming days, with a blast of Saharan air triggering red alerts from France to the Swiss Alps.】

item.title: 英国电网投资者回报率将在扩建推进过程中跃升
item.description: 英国能源监管机构制定了一项计划，以提高投资者投入电网公司股权的回报率，帮助支持未来五年内关键基础设施的大规模升级。【原文：The UK energy regulator set out a plan to increase the returns that investors can get on equity put into grid companies helping underpin a huge push to upgrade critical infrastructure during the next five years.】

item.title: 美国初创企业收购波兰 Northvolt 公司，押注电池业蓬勃发展
item.description: 加利福尼亚州初创公司 Lyten 正在从 Northvolt AB 手中收购一家波兰储能工厂，希望凭借硫基电池成为全球领先企业。【原文：California startup Lyten is buying a Polish energy-storage factory from Northvolt AB in a bid to become a global leader with its sulfur-based batteries.】

item.title: 汽车制造商就 "激进 "排放限制与印度发生冲突
item.description: 汽车制造商正在对印度提出的碳排放限制和轻型汽车新标准计划进行反击，称这个南亚国家利用法规来阻止地球变暖的温室气体排放 "过于激进"。【原文：Automakers are pushing back against India’s proposed carbon emission limits and plans for new standards for lighter cars, terming the South Asian nation’s use of regulation to stem planet-warming greenhouse gases as “too aggressive.”】

item.title: 澳大利亚东海岸预计将出现暴雨和恶劣天气
item.description: 未来几天，悉尼可能会遭受一个多月的降雨和恶劣天气的袭击，因为东海岸附近的强低压系统会袭击悉尼，以及今年已经遭受特大洪水袭击的地区。【原文：Sydney could be be hit by more than a month’s worth of rain and severe weather in the coming days as an intense low-pressure system off the east coast batters the city, as well as regions already hit by extreme flooding this year.】

item.title: 太阳能和风能产业面临参议院税收法案的威胁
item.description:
拟议的消费税将加剧补贴逐步取消带来的痛苦。【原文：

A proposed excise tax would exacerbate the pain from the phaseout of subsidies. 

】

item.title: 美国房地产市场推动法国 ESG 数据公司扩张
item.description: 一家总部位于巴黎、专门从事房地产业务的 ESG 数据公司正计划大幅增加其在美国的业务，因为该公司认为美国人很快就需要更加关注其住宅和办公室的能源效率。【原文：A Paris-based ESG data firm specialized in real estate is planning to dramatically increase its presence in the US, based on an assessment that Americans will soon need to pay more attention to how energy efficient their homes and offices are.】

item.title: 澳大利亚耗资 15 亿澳元启动家庭电池发展计划
item.description: 澳大利亚启动了一项耗资 23 亿澳元（15 亿美元）的计划，鼓励家庭购买电池，以吸收过剩的可再生能源，并抑制世界上最不稳定的电力市场之一的价格波动。【原文：Australia started a A$2.3 billion ($1.5 billion) program to encourage households to buy batteries in an effort to absorb excess renewable energy and curb price swings in one of the world’s most volatile power markets.】

item.title: 摩根大通高管称政治不能阻碍气候议程
item.description: 自唐纳德-特朗普连任以来，华尔街放弃了公共气候联盟，减少了多元化举措。但美国银行家们希望欧洲人知道，这并不是故事的全部。【原文：Since Donald Trump’s re-election, Wall Street has abandoned public climate alliances and toned down diversity initiatives. But US bankers want Europeans to know that’s not the whole story.】

item.title: 加拿大大型油田因野火排放出 2021 年以来最多的天然气
item.description: Cenovus Energy Inc.的克里斯蒂娜湖油砂基地在今年 5 月的一场野火迫使该设施紧急关闭后，向大气排放了四年多来最多的天然气。【原文：Cenovus Energy Inc.’s Christina Lake oil-sands site vented the most natural gas in more than four years into the atmosphere when a wildfire forced an emergency shutdown of the facility in May.】

item.title: 荷兰推迟对 TenneT 的德国电网交易做出决定
item.description: 荷兰政府需要更多时间来评估 TenneT Holding BV 德国高压电业务的选择方案，并可能在 9 月份做出决定。【原文：The Dutch government needs more time to assess the options for TenneT Holding BV’s German high-voltage business and a decision is likely to come in September.】

item.title: 美联储气候事务高官凯文-斯蒂罗离开美国中央银行
item.description: 美联储负责气候变化相关金融风险的最高级官员凯文-斯蒂罗（Kevin Stiroh）已离开美国中央银行。【原文：Kevin Stiroh, the Federal Reserve’s most senior official focused on the financial risks associated with climate change, has left the US central bank.】

item.title: 巴巴多斯在全球债券销售中首次推出灾害保护条款
item.description: 巴巴多斯成为第一个出售债券的国家，这些债券规定，如果国家遭受自然灾害或大流行病的肆虐，政府在偿还债务时可获得减免，这为其他国家在出售债券时加入类似条款铺平了道路。【原文：Barbados became the first nation to sell bonds that give the government a break on debt payments if the country is ravaged by a natural disaster or pandemic, paving the way for others to include similar provisions in their debt sales.】

item.title: 谷歌与英联邦达成电力协议，押注聚变未来
item.description:
谷歌还将再次投资 Commonwealth 公司，该公司预计其首个商用发电厂将于 2030 年代初建成发电

。【原文：

Google will also invest again in Commonwealth, which expects its first commercial plant will generate power in the early 2030s

】

item.title: 参议院审议取消税收减免法案，可再生能源股价下滑
item.description: 参议院就最新版支出方案展开辩论，该方案将逐步取消对风能和太阳能的关键税收优惠政策，同时向化石燃料提供支持。【原文：Shares of renewable energy companies tumbled while coal miners surged as the Senate debates the latest version of a spending package that would phase out key tax incentives for wind and solar while aiding fossil fuels.】

item.title: 热浪加剧，欧洲日前电量飙升
item.description: 由于严酷的热浪导致降温需求增加，法国一些核反应堆的电力供应紧张，本周二交付的电力价格飙升至数月来的最高水平。【原文：Power prices for delivery on Tuesday spiked to the highest level for months as a brutal heat wave drives up demand for cooling and crimps supply from some French nuclear reactors.】

item.title: 印度七月降雨量将高于正常水平，促进农作物播种
item.description: 7 月份是季风季节最潮湿的月份，预计印度的降雨量将高于正常水平，这将促进水稻、大豆和玉米等主要农作物的播种前景。【原文：India is expected to receive above-normal rainfall in July, the wettest month of the monsoon season, boosting prospects for the planting of key crops such as rice, soybeans, and corn.】

item.title: 热浪引发健康警报，欧洲削减核电
item.description: 炙烤西欧的热浪将在未来几天达到顶峰，威胁到电力网络并引发健康警报。【原文：The heat wave searing western Europe is set to peak in the coming days, threatening power networks and triggering health alerts.】

item.title: 热浪来袭时，伦敦地铁车厢可能比街道温度高 5 摄氏度
item.description: 对于挤在狭窄车厢里、脸贴着汗湿腋窝的伦敦乘客来说，每天都是热浪，而每次热浪都是地狱。【原文：For London commuters squished into cramped carriages, faces against sweaty armpits, every day is a heat wave, and every heat wave is an inferno.】

item.title: 波兰六年来首次出售绿色债券
item.description: 波兰时隔六年多重返绿色债券市场，为加速能源转型寻求融资支持。【原文：Poland is returning to the green bond market after more than six years as it seeks a financing boost for its accelerating energy transformation.】
